creditline: Gift of Gabriel P. and Yvonne M.L. Weisberg for the Weisberg Collection of European Drawings and Prints of the Nineteenth and Early Twentieth Centuries
description: standing woman wearing dark long skirt, white blouse, hat with wide brim and scarf tied around her head, with bundles on her back and around her waist, carrying a staff in her PL hand resting on her PL shoulder; little boy standing to left of woman, wearing pants, jacket and light-colored hat, holding a stick in his PR hand
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash
provenance: Acquired on art market, 1988 ('Dutch dealer), through Richard Campbell, MIA
signed: Right edge below center, in brown: Decamps / a hierres (?) 1825
text: A distracted student, Alexandre-Gabriel Decamps disliked the large academic studios of his brief training and was largely self-taught. This rare early drawing dates from the year before his debut at the Paris Salons. It reveals his early interest in rural subjects and talent for naturalistic description.
title: Peasant Woman Standing with Boy
